intro: Pectis rosei, commonly known as the rose hairpuff, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flower heads that are composed of many small florets. Pectis rosei typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
